findings.title: Integer Underflow in balance subtraction
findings.explanation: The check `require(balances[msg.sender] - _value >= 0)` performs the subtraction before the comparison. In Solidity 0.4.18 unsigned integer underflow wraps around, so if `_value` is greater than the sender's balance the subtraction underflows to a large number, bypassing the check entirely and allowing an attacker to transfer more tokens than they own.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a safe math library that reverts on underflow, such as OpenZeppelin's SafeMath. Replace `balances[msg.sender] -= _value` with `balances[msg.sender] = balances[msg.sender].sub(_value)` after importing SafeMath.

findings.title: Integer Overflow in balance addition
findings.explanation: There is no check for overflow when adding `_value` to `balances[_to]`. If `balances[_to]` is near the maximum uint value, the addition will wrap around to a small value.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a safe math library that reverts on overflow, such as OpenZeppelin's SafeMath. Replace `balances[_to] += _value` with `balances[_to] = balances[_to].add(_value)` after importing SafeMath.
